Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on Risk Factors for Postoperative Chronic Opioid Use

Trial_Design.evidence: Randomisation was conducted by an NHIS big data system manager.

Participants.evidence: Participants included 1,108,119 patients aged seven years or older who underwent surgery, survived at least one year, and had no additional surgeries.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to identify risk factors and develop prediction models for postoperative chronic opioid use (PCOU).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was PCOU incidence.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was conducted by an NHIS big data system manager.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Participants included 1,108,119 patients aged seven years or older who underwent surgery, survived at least one year, and had no additional surgeries.

Result_Outcome.evidence: PCOU occurred in 9308 patients (0.84%). Older age, preoperative history of opioid use, and high in-hospital opioid doses were the most significant predictors.
